item.title: More PowerShell Remoting coverage in dbatools
item.description: Starting on dbatools version 1.0.31 we introduced better coverage for commands that make use of PowerShell Remoting. Commands like Get-DbaComputerCertificate, Get-DbaPrivilege, Get-DbaClientAlias, just to mention a few of them, make use of the internal function Invoke-Command2 which uses New-PSSession when we run it against a remote computer. Let me give you a little bit of background… At my company, I found that some dbatools commands were not working. item.title: 'Invalid class [0x80041010]' error when trying to access SQLServer's WMI classes
item.description: I was using open source PowerShell module dbatools (GitHub repository) to get the list of SQL Server services I have on a bunch of hosts so I could confirm if they are in “running” state. – Quick note – For those who don’t know, dbatools is a module, written by the community, that makes SQL Server administration much easier using PowerShell. Today, the module has more than 260 commands. Go get it and try it!
